Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Akseliko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally superb but the wi-fi connection is too costly, even an hour cost is 6 euro and too much formalities just to get an bording card print, you have to pay via credit card etc. Location is not sa far to Prado Museum, Retiro Park and other specific palaces, Historical building, large rooms, perfect bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charles_Simon
Reviews.Content: This classic hotel Has one the best locations in Madrid, in the upscale Salamanca neighborhood with the Retiro Park a few blocks away, Serrano street just 2 blocks away and many excellent places to eat just around the corner. The hotel is vey old fashioned but the rooms were very clean, spacious, the bathroom is also confortable and new. Internet is very expensive so you have to go down to the lobby to use it for free. Overall its an excellent option for the price you pay. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “old fashion - little comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jacopone
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located: being in the barrio Salamanca one of the best neighbourhood of the city. The hotel it self is perfectly in line with the old fashion style of many bars and restaurants of Madrid, which is very nice. Also, despite being in the city centre, the hotel is very quite. But there are some relevant minus. First, rooms are really small: in my room there was barely a square meter of floor available to moving around, there was only one small table fully occupied by the tv, and not any chair…quite disappointing indeed. Differently, the bathroom was spacious and recently renovated. Second, if you like a comfortable bed do not stay there: the mattress of my bed was so hard that had I slept on the floor it would have been the same. Third, the personnel at the desk are really impolite, they barely say a word, no smile, no useful information provided. If returning to Madrid I would rather go in one of the NH hotels in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: MD K
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly unimpressed with this hotel. The front desk staff was curt and unhelpful. Internet was expensive and slow at best, with several outages the week I was there. I was in a room facing the interior courtyard ( these are the smaller, cheaper rooms). The room had virtually no natural light, and the a/c unit on the roof was really noisy. (I saw their suites, which were larger and had better views and better light.) my refrigerator and thermostat were both broken. the decor is dated and shabby looking. The meeting room has roaches (big ones!). And it was overpriced. Basically I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Ever. A few upsides: very friendly and helpful restaurant staff. It's a nice neighborhood with upscale shopping and some decent restaurants. Located an easy walk to retiro park, but you will need to metro or cab to any other tourist sites. La rouleta bar nextdoor has fantastic gin and tonics. There are many better choices for better value in this neighborhood or even more centrally located neighborhoods.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4* - and not recommended”
Reviews.Author: GeordieGirl123
Reviews.Content: We had booked a superior junior suite but were only given a normal suite. Not too much of a problem but a bit annoying. Due to a late flight we arrived at the hotel at 10pm and the member of staff on reception seemed disgruntled that we had interupted whatever he was doing. The room was very dated and needs work to modernise it. The room was comfortable but very, very dark. We were given a room on the first floor - due to the location of the room we received no natural light which was awful. We only booked this hotel due to an offer through an online booking agent - there is no way we would pay the normal price which was supposed to be £600 for four nights - you can get more modern hotels closer to the city centre with nicer members of staff for a much cheaper price. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: MelanieBOND
Reviews.Content: Hotel staffs are very warmth and pleasant, wide choice in breakfast buffet, spacious room,clean and location is perfect! It's worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Cordy3-11
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many city hotels this does not live up to it's four star rating. We booked the Hotel Ada Palace and on arrival were told there was no hot water and therefore moved and upgraded in this hotel. Reception girl surly and rude and the upgrade was a suite. On entering suite 404 the carpet had four large stains and the settee had overstuffed cushions which were not comfortable. We had one grey worn out robe for two people? Room tired and dated wood cabinets and skirting boards covered in dust. We were ignored by batman whilst he served everyone else and when we asked for some ice we were told to use room service. What a joke, rang number and the man said No Comprehendo! ...unbelievable for a four star hotel, he then put me through to the front desk who did not better and transferred the call back to room service...breakfast lovely and complimentary due to move, however we chose original hotel due to location, this hotel is not where we would have chosen, it's more of a shopping area. Lack of basic manners and linguistic skills have let this hotel down. Been Barcelona, Paris, Prague, Rome and more and nowhere has been like this expereince. The Original hotel we booked never attempted to make contact, keep us informed or offer us return there and would make me wary of booking agent in future.

Reviews.Title: “Old fashioned but reasonable quality and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Phillip S
Reviews.Content: Free WiFi did not have internet connected and they did not get it fixed - otherwise the hotel was clean and main areas are quite sumptuous and refined. Great Bloody Mary - breakfast buffet OK. Upgrade to triple suit left me with a view into an internal light tunnel - but the room was OK. Phone did not work in the room.

Reviews.Title: “nice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Location is very good - 30 min walk to Prado and Thyssen, 10 min walk to the metro. The room was great (junior suite) and very good value. Breakfast was also excellent - wide selection of 'heavy' and 'light' foods - lovely stock of fruits. WiFi and internet access charge. The size of the elevator is too small.

Reviews.Title: “Excelente Hotel”
Reviews.Author: franklinroa
Reviews.Content: Si viajas a Madrid te recomiendo el Hotel Gran Velazquez, el cual se encuentra en el Barrio de Salamanca, muy buena ubicacion, habitaciones lujosas, muy comodas y excelente mantenimiento y precios solidarios. Te lo recomiendo ampliamente

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cecilia D
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent alternative when selecting an hotel. It is located in a wonderful place with lot of restaurants, shops, boutiques. As it is not a brand new hotel, the rooms are very big and confortables, also the bathrooms and they has a nice decoration. The relation price-quality is excellent. The only "but" : it doesn´t have a lobby, only a recepcion desk

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Juan L
Reviews.Content: old hotel, bad service and they charge you for internet which is free in most hotels. rooms are old and a bit uncomfortable and breakfast is horrible. Its not worth for money

Reviews.Title: “"Borderline but cool..."”
Reviews.Author: AdrianS779
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nice neighborhood, walking distance to park and the subway was only three blocks down and to the left. Would I say the front desk were warm and friendly? No, would I say they were unhelpful and rude? No...just all business and no nonsense. Although, if you strike up a conversation in Spanish, that brings a bit more warmth. They spoke English as well.Has some nice restaurants across the street and around the neighborhood as well, so choices for food were endless. I especially like having the awesome shop Mallorca across the way, filled with wonderful edibles! Back to the hotel, room was very clean but a tad smelly of smoke but with the window open for fresh air, it wore off very quickly. It's Spain, they smoke..what are you going to do? I will say the elevator is small, so if you've a ton of bags...better wait for it to be clear or you won't fit it all in, but timing wise one can take the stairs as well. Location wise, I would have to say for the price a fairly decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL service”
Reviews.Author: Caity S
Reviews.Content: The staff was pretentious and rude from the moment we checked in, in fact they were so bad that we didn't complain about any of the issues with the room for fear of speaking with them again. A few of the minor complaints we had: the bathtub leaked, the "interactive" TV had only CNN, our key cards deactivated after each use & the bath towels had holes in them. That being said, this is a great, central location within walking distance of restaurants and shopping, it just wasn't worth the cost from our point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Alexey Z
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great upscale neighborhood full of shops, right down the street from Retiro Park and within walking distance to museums, restaurants, etc. Nice bar--and a great buffet breakfast. Staff is friendly, helpful, and polite; rooms are clean and bright and well-maintained. I was there with small children and they made every accommodation for us. A lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great in a very smart neighbourhood, on a very frequent bus route, near good shops and cafes. The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was very simple, but clean and with all that was needed to make the stay comfortable. And best of all, the price was much lower than the quality would make one expect.

Reviews.Title: “Old style slightly creaking at the edges Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamescim
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night as a colleague had already booked, and whilst it is in a nice area the Hotel is just a little bit worn out, from the small receptionist area, to the 10 odd steps to get to either one of the 2 person lifts. My room faced onto a central open area on the Hotel, it was OK, Air Con took a while to kick in. There are plenty of bars outside, we went to one oppostie which was full so we went left out of the Hotel and went to another on the corner with 60 odd Iberico Legs hanging up, which was good. Bed was OK and so was the shower. Breakfast had a good selection of Cheeses, Fruit Bread & scary looking stuff in hot plates, which didn't like it had been touched for a while. Overall it was OK in a very old style 4 star Hotel way.

Reviews.Title: “It's seen its better days! There are better hotels in the area.”
Reviews.Author: EJGMIA
Reviews.Content: This sixty five year old hotel has seen its better days. It has an excellent location in the middle of the Salamanca distric in Madrid and the hotel is surrounded by excellent restaurants, shops and elegant neightbors. The rooms are quite different from one another and I had to reject the first Junior Suite assigned to me (very small) and the second, facing Ave. Velazquez was large but faded. Some of the problems with the hotel are, the tiny two person elevators do not reach the lobby level and you must carry your luggage ten steps up the stairs to reach elevators. The mattresses are the worst experienced in forty five years of travelling, the coils can be felt on your back as you try to sleep on the very uncomfortable bed. The bathroom has no exhaust. The noise can be very bad from the taxi drivers below the window. The music from the bar can be heard until closing time on weekends. The room doors do not have peep holes.I had two Tv's on my JR. Suite, one was an old box type that must have been at least twenty years old and the other a flat screen only 26" in size. I only had one control for both TV's. The bar is very expensive, a bottle of mineral water is 7.00 Euros (about $ 11.00). Breakfast is good and plentifull.

Reviews.Title: “A nice traditional Spanish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Radiohead319
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the mod cons of typical European chain hotels, then don't come here find the local Marriot or Hilton instead. But if you want to experience some of the real Madrid, then this hotel gives good value. It has a kind of worn bygone splendour about it. It is very definitely a traditional hotel. The service is good, but for my tastes a little over-formal with not many, if any smiles. I was upgraded to a suite which had a generous sized double bedroom, a separate lounge with sofa and bathroom. The lounge did not have an externally facing window, so I doubt it could ever be sold as a full-price suite! Breakfast was very good, but traditional spanish - so lots of fruit and cold meats, but the cooked breakfast did not look great. Strangely the only choice of cereal was two types of chocolate things only suitable for kids. No muesli, cornflakes etc etc. I was there for a business meeting and the buffet lunch was really excellent. Much better than anything you get in typical UK hotels! The barman was surly, bordering on rude and clearly needs to find himself another job. All the other staff seemed polite and efficient, if lacking in smiles and that sort of informal welcome that I tend to like. WiFi costs extra - a lot extra! Also the signal was quite weak in my room. Despite what someone else said, the hotel is in a nice district. I didn't actually see the shops, but you could imagine it is the sort of area where you would find the designer shops that no-one ever goes in (you know - Channel, Louis Vuitton etc!). There is a very nice modern and reasonably priced tapas bar almost opposite. Metro from the airport was a very pleasant experience. Only 2 euro and very modern and air conditioned. Took around 30-40 minutes to get to Velazquez station with one change, then a 5 minute stroll to hotel. All in all a very nice hotel - I would consider coming back here for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quaint hotel, great location, great junior suite”
Reviews.Author: jmdmd1
Reviews.Content: Charming, clean, safe. Front desk staff were very helpful

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISAPPOINTING!”
Reviews.Author: glenoaks3
Reviews.Content: Our Spanish friends recommended Gran Hotel Velazquez,so we booked an executive suite with breakfast for 5 days.Being new to Madrid, we asked the front desk for recommendations and directions for bus and Metro, but received poor and vague answers. They did not specify the name of the street for the Metro stop or the street name where the bus stops near the Prado Museum. The very worse experience we encountered was being robbed in the Metro station at Bilbao.We hurried back to the hotel and told the front desk of our disaster, only for him to say" bad luck." We asked for help to reach the credit card companies and received a telephone number to dial by ourselves. We only got Spanish speaking operators. After going back and forth to the front desk several times, we finally got the correct international number. It took over an hour and half to cancel our credit cards by ourselves with no help from the hotel staff. Within this hour, we learned the robber had made charges with our stolen credit cards immediately.The two men staff was not busy at the time. We find it inexcusable for this hotel staff to not actively help their guests who are in great distress and in need of help at such a crucial time. This hotel staff must improve their service to guests. I saw an elderly gentleman guest carrying his wife's wheelchair down the stairs from the elevator. Someone from staff should have come to his aid, regardless if he asked for help or not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, convenient location (museums, shopping, and airport)”
Reviews.Author: ferraridin0
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4Star hotel, good buffet breakfast, convenient to Metro, convenient to airport ( rental car/taxi ). Have stayed here many times over the past ten years or more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Penn_00
Reviews.Content: We were booked into Maria Elena Palace near Gran Via, but on arrival we were transferred to Hotel V because of water supply problems. We were concerned we would be taken somewhere far and remote, but this change was the best thing that happened to us! We were given a suite, great space, breakfast was grand, the location was perfect with great shopping and beautiful residential buildings and shops beneath (and not a street worker in sight). We would recommend this area and hotel to anyone- beware of Gran Via Area as it's quite unpleasant, which we didn't know. Staff were good, one was unimpressive (didn't smile and just answered yes/no to our touristy questions, no suggestions) but none were rude.

Reviews.Title: “A Great stay as always....”
Reviews.Author: AlfonsoML
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff (as long as you know what to expect from a Spanish Staff), Comfortable Rooms, Great Breakfast, Great Room Service, terrible Elevators! Do not miss this great hotel on your next visit to Madrid, You can not go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Ex_camper
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the hotel offered a nice breakfast with an abundant choice of foods. Our room was clean, but one has to pay extra for Wi-Fi here (this is not a budget property), and neither the room temperature control nor the TV remote worked. It was reasonably quiet, but be aware that if you have heavy luggage the elevator does not go all the way to the ground floor. The hotel had no lobby to speak of, and felt rather dated. To me, the facility seemed to be living off it's location in a high rent neighborhood and what I imagine might be a reputation earned in an earlier era.

Reviews.Title: “elegant rooms and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: leisure-traveller44
Reviews.Content: Although we had a relatively small room (since most of the hotel comprises junior suites), it was still ample in size, and very quiet (as we requested). The furnishings were elegant and clean. There was only one English channel on the TV (Sky1 I think or perhaps Sky News); there was a nice range of toiletries in the bathroom. Pillows were memory foam, but an ordinary polyfill was in the wardrobe. Breakfast was exceptional in its range! Good fresh and dried fruit, a large numbers of cakes, pastries, breads, a baked flan, and the usual cereals, meats and sausages--but also a wide range of cheeses and dried Spanish ham. Only the juice was disappointing. Coffee was Nespresso.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, lazy, unhelpfull staff and far away from Prado and Centre”
Reviews.Author: Rawumber
Reviews.Content: We were offloaded to this hotel after having booked at the Maria Elena Palace which is located in a much more central area. We were told this was due to a problem with the water but I suspect it was due to overbooking. We were encouraged to accept this hotel on the basis that it was also a ten minute walk from the Prado gallery. Very unsatisfactory as I had spent a lot of time researching a suitable hotel located close to the galleries. It was in fact a 30 min. walk or train ride. Mainly expensive designer shops in this area. The staff (with the exception of one female reception desk manager) were very unhelpful and rude. We needed assistance getting tickets to a particular exhibition (Sorrolla) but they refused to make any calls or enquiries for us. Finally found out we could buy tickets at the Tourist office by a chance conversation with another tourist. Internet expensive and not efficient. We were given a suite in compensation which was large and well furnished with a good bathroom. Breakfast quite good with many options which was included in our room rate. Decor very dated and quite run down, particularly in the public areas. Looked like it hadn't been refurbished since the 1970's. Limited English spoken by staff. Very few restaurants close by. Not a good location for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “1st Impression Sucks!”
Reviews.Author: HermanEurope
Reviews.Content: I would like to comment on the customer service I received from this hotel even before I get to stay there. I called up the receptionist to check out the rates for a double bedroom but the tone of voice of the person who picked up the call wasn't very friendly nor enthusiastic at all. In the meantime, I did send an email to enquire about the room rates as well. No replies or whatsoever were received. Can you imagine the type of service you will receive if you were to stay there. No way!!! First impression already let me down. Herman

Reviews.Title: “High-End Location, not so high-end hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcgiggles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a total of six days. The first several days I had a room facing the courtyard, and though it was darker, it was a little quieter than the second room I had. I had a king bed with a very firm mattress (I liked this), and the SMALL bathroom had a variety of shower heads which was nice. Other than that, I would NOT consider this hotel a 4 star. It was an average hotel in a very expensive part of town. If you want bargains, this is not the area because all the stores are designer stores like Escada, Burberry etc. It did, however, feel like a safe area. The service was lousy, and I always felt like I was bothering the staff when I had a question. And the internet charge is outrageous. 12 euros for 24 hours (6 euros for 1 hour) and there's no place to print! (there is a store called VIPS that's two blocks away that offers free wifi is you eat there. Also a good place to by snacks and beverages). Like others have said, it's not in the central part of Madrid so you'd have to walk almost an hour to get to the more touristy areas. Fortunately, the metro stop is only a couple of blocks away and there are taxi's right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, wrong location”
Reviews.Author: Funtravel85
Reviews.Content: This is a nice decent hotel but unless you like walking a half hour to the center or taking a bus everywhere, choose a hotel closer to the center. We left after two nights for the High Tech Petit Palace de Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MEB2009
Reviews.Content: This is NOT, repeat NOT a 4 star hotel. My cousin (late 60's) and I (early 50's) both female, arrived from NY having booked almost two months in advance. Having recently had shoulder surgery, my arm was in a sling. Upon arrival no one came to assist with luggage, even the cabdriver commented. I went in to check in while my cousin stayed on the busy sidewalk with the luggage. I was told by the less than cordial management that the porters were "busy". While this might explain a delay in delivering our bags to our room somehow it did not explain leaving them on the sidewalk. We were left to bring them into the lobby ourselves as none of the men behind the reception desk were so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year's break”
Reviews.Author: ScubagirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Great location, lovely rooms. Well worth it. Joanna

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in Lobby”
Reviews.Author: SpainProblems
Reviews.Content: While we waited (and waited) in the lobby to check in to this hotel, a purse and backpack were stolen from our belongings. Admittedly we had taken our eyes off of them, but we felt a false sense of security in the lobby with bellman around a sign that said they had video surveillance. The staff were uninpressed that two bags had been stolen from under their noses, and provided no support. As long as hotels like this shrug their shoulders at petty theft in their own lobby, it will go on at a steady pace.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: pjeanne
Reviews.Content: close to metro and buses even though it is not in the heart of the action. The room was very nice (was upgraded to a suite!) but beware the noise coming from the Av Velazquez. The phonic isolation is not very good and you can really hear traffic. Breakfast was excellent and service very good. A good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surly staff”
Reviews.Author: elizalily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times before, but this time the man at reception was surly, Our room had two windows, both with views of blank walls and one had the bonus of views of trailing wires and lots of pipes too. We had asked for a double bed and were given twins. We were too tired to complain. The breakfast was excellent, but the staff lack charm! Next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at attractive price”
Reviews.Author: mmcdeb
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with spacious, clean, bright rooms, definitively 4 stars plus and is a terrific price/value. The location is in a lovely upscale area within walking distance of the Centro, Grand Via, and museums provided you like to walk, We are talking a 20 minute not a five minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in the best part of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Eugene K
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed at this hotel in early October. We loved it. The service was wonderful. The hotel was gorgeous. It is pricey, but worth it. The only issue we had was that though we asked for a nonsmoking room, our next door neighbor was a chain smoker. By morning, our room smelled like a smoke tavern. Management told us that they had only one floor for nonsmokers. The location couldn't be better. It is prime area. Great restuarants, tapas bars, and stores all around. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quality location”
Reviews.Author: HelgLon
Reviews.Content: spent long weekend sightseeing, searched long for right hotel and was attracted by website and reasonable pricing. Bit anxious on arrival to see if we made the right choice. But expectations were more than met. Very nice king-sized bed, large sitting room and very nice bathroom with good window. Room insulation very good and breakfast buffet more than sufficient. Did not use nice bar and elegant restaurant as we were out most of the time. Location in elegant residential cum shopping area, short taxi ride to museums and town centre. Glad did not stay there as it is quite hectic and many hotels are surrounded by traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cannot accommodate more than two”
Reviews.Author: DCtravel68
Reviews.Content: Be cautious in booking this hotel if you have more than two people. I booked a room on the internet for three adults. After faxing the hotel three time for confirmation without a reply, I called on the telephone. I was told to call back a second time as there was no reservation person available. After a lengthy search the clerk found my reservation but said "we have not had any extra beds for five months." She was not helpful in offering alternatives. We canceled the reservation and now do not have a room for next week in Madrid on a busy weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DublinDolphin
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in a great location. Bedrooms are nice and cosy. The beds in the twin room are sightly bigger than a regular single bed which is nice. Showers are excellent. Breakfast was not included but that was not an issue. There is a fabulous delicatessen type shop across the road and up about 40 yards and they have a great select and well priced. The hotel is number 62 on the street but we went for dinner in Boggo restaurant one night, it is about number 100 or so on the same street ... less than 10 minute walk, the food and service were fabulous. There were very few other diners perhaps because it was a Sunday night but would definitely recommend the restaurant. They don't serve food until 9pm. Would definitely recommend getting the metro from the airport as it is very cheap and trouble free. Would recommend you get off at the Velazquez stop rather then the one recommended on the hotel website. For those that like shopping the hotel is very well situated ... less than 7 minutes walk to all the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Velazquez!!!”
Reviews.Author: roxjc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous!! My cousin has lived all her life in Madrid and when I asked her to help me out with a hotel she told me stay in Gran Velazquez...she said "do not stay in a hotel in the Gran Via because it's not a very good place to walk at night time". When I went online and saw the room pictures, I was not impressed, but being the case that she has lived all her life there, I knew it had to have a charm. Was she right! Ask to stay on one of the rooms that are double, but bigger (I believe they call it a junior suite. The beds are very comfortable and very spacious (you rarely find this in Europe). It also had a farely big balcony. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. You also have a butler that is a very good magician!! Our trip consisted of 5 hotels (one of them in Barcelona which we paid $400.00/night) and at the end of our trip, we asked each one of us...."what hotel did we like best? The four of us said "Gran Velazquez"! Roxana Quintana, Miami, Florida

Reviews.Title: “loved the Velazquez in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: liales
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel in nice location, the best shopping quarter, and near to the Great Museums. It is a rather old building, very well kept, the room very very comfortable, with a wonderful new marble bathroom... And the best breakfast you might ever wish

Reviews.Title: “Not Appropriate for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: ExpatLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gran Hotel Velazquez for business travel and extended for the weekend. The hotel certainly had old-fashioned charm and some beautiful features but I found the service sub par for business travel. Not only is there no iron in your room, but the hotel does not have one at all, making business appropriate dressing difficult. Also, the hallways are not carpeted and are therefore quite loud. Since tourists keep late hours in Madrid, it is again not ideal for business travel. Finally, I was very disappointed in the room cleaning as dirty items such as drinking glasses were never replaced. In fact, it looked like items such as stationery and menus had been there as long as the hotel as they were quite yellow. I would recommed the hotel for personal travel when you need a good deal as the room rate was reasonable. But certainly there are hotels with much better quality of service in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible at all”
Reviews.Author: Harveymtl
Reviews.Content: For the money I would say this hotel was pretty good. Clean, nice rooms, beautiful bathroom. The location is not quite downtown but very close for a reasonable cab ride. Dont bring a car to this hotel though, the lot is small (4 cars) and I wouldnt feel comfortable leaving it in a public garage.

Reviews.Title: “Not Gran but pretty good”
Reviews.Author: mixers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times as it is always booked for me on business trips. The staff are very much in the old school of hotel staff and although helpful are rather cold and aloof. All the rooms I have stayed in have been large, comfortable and with great bathrooms. The breakfast buffet is good and there is another separate restaurant just around the corner which is owned by the company and which is better and less formal than the hotel one. There are better places to stay at in Madrid, but this is central and pretty good value for a 4 star. Last time I stayed there was September 2003 and the manager told me that there was a programme of refurbishment in progress. Check out the special deals online.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if less than $100 night”
Reviews.Author: SteveinPhilly
Reviews.Content: We got a 70.00E per night rate using Orbitz without the breakfast (which is worth 18.00 E per person but we didn't need that much. We got a room - like other poster - next to elevator - on top (8th) floor. But it was a suite with a TV room next to noisy elevator and bedroom quiet. Great UPSCALE neighborhood. If paying over 110 E without Breakfast (or 130 E with buffet) I might look elsewhere but I thought we got a bargain. And conventient to Metro and direct bus to Puerto del sol.Steve

Reviews.Title: “do not expect too much”
Reviews.Author: YF212
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel room through Priceline for five days' stay and ended up in a room right next to the elevator. That means I spent nights awake listening to the elevator goes up and down and up and down again, not to mention people walking/talking in the corridor. That is how thin those walls are. And all these were not made up by some reasonable service one would expect from a 4-stars hotel. The staff are cold and unhelpful. To give an example, the bell-boy had the gut to just walk away when he saw us with five baggages and were told that we were heading for the airport, and showed up again after some 20 minutes right when we were closing the taxi door. The only good things I can say about this hotel is its location and the room is clean.
